suite.name: System Log Test

kw.name: Connect To Database
kw.msg: Connect to DB using : psycopg2.connect(database='railway', user='postgres', password=***, host='switchback.proxy.rlwy.net', port=54228)
kw.doc: Creates a database connection using the DB API 2.0 ``db_module`` and the parameters provided. Along with listed commonly used arguments (`db_name`, `db_host` etc.) you can set any other DB module specific parameters as key/value pairs.

test.name: 1. Verify SystemLog INFO Created After Successful Login

kw.name: Get Latest System Log For Login
Get Latest System Log For Path
Query
kw.msg:
Executing sql:
SELECT "level","method","path","statusCode","duration","userId","ipAddress","userAgent" FROM "SystemLog" WHERE "method"='POST' AND "path"='/api/auth/login' ORDER BY "createdAt" DESC LIMIT 1;

Query returned 1 rows
RowlevelmethodpathstatusCodedurationuserIdipAddressuserAgent
0INFOPOST/api/auth/login20074None::ffff:100.64.0.3python-requests/2.32.5
kw.arg: SELECT "level","method","path","statusCode","duration","userId","ipAddress","userAgent" FROM "SystemLog" WHERE "method"='${method}' AND "path"='${path}' ORDER BY "createdAt" DESC LIMIT 1;
kw.doc: Runs a query with the ``select_statement`` and returns the result as list of rows. The type of row values depends on the database module - usually they are tuples or tuple-like objects.

kw.name: Get Latest System Log By Level
Query
kw.msg:
Executing sql:
SELECT "level","method","path","statusCode","userId" FROM "SystemLog" WHERE "level"='ERROR' ORDER BY "createdAt" DESC LIMIT 1;

Query returned 1 rows
RowlevelmethodpathstatusCodeuserId
0ERRORPOST/api/auth/login400None
